articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Coal Mine
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Coal Mine
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju visited the February 8 Jikdong Youth Coal Mine under the Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex alive with the drive for increased production.
					 After learning about the mine development, he went round pit No. 6 to learn in detail about mechanization, tunneling and transport capacity.
					
					 He met miners who are fulfilling the daily production quota more than 150 percent to congratulate them on their successes and encouraged them to increase coal production, true to the intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He underlined the need to increase coal production, true to the intention of the Workers' Party of Korea on concentrating all our efforts on building an economic giant to bring about a fresh turn in developing the country's economy and improving the people's standard of living.
					
					 A consultative meeting there discussed issues of stepping up the general mechanization of the work in pit and putting efforts into coal dressing and other issues of increasing coal production.

articles.title: Concert of Young Vanguard Held
articles.content:
Concert of Young Vanguard Held
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- A loyalty concert of young vanguard "Great sun and invincible youth power" took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Sunday to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					 The concert started with prelude "Song of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League". 
					
					 The concert ended with revolutionary paean "Ode to General Kim Jong Un". It showed the will of young vanguard to demonstrate the honor of vanguard and shock brigade in construction sites for building a thriving nation. 
					
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, Yang Hyong Sop, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Kim Su Gil, chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, officials concerned, officials of the youth league and the delegates to the events for celebrating the anniversary of the youth league.

articles.title: Receptions Given to Mark Birthday of Youth League
articles.content:
Receptions Given to Mark Birthday of Youth League
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Receptions were given at the People's Palace of Culture, Okryu Restaurant, Chongryu Restaurant and Pyongyang Noodle House Sunday to celebrate the 70th founding anniversary of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned and officials of the youth league.
					
					 Present there on invitation were delegates to the events for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the youth league.
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers recalled that Marshal Kim Jong Un saw to it that the 70th founding anniversary of the youth league was celebrated with splendor, adding:
					
					 He is the benevolent father and great teacher who spares nothing for the youth and no youth in the world are as happy and proud as the Korean youth who are under his warm care,
					
					 They called for fully glorifying the honor of reliable reserves, advanced group and wing of the Workers' Party of Korea in the on-going general advance, always keeping in their mind Marshal Kim Jong Un's affection and trust in them.

articles.title: Korean Youth Vow to Carry Forward Revolutionary Cause of Juche
articles.content:
Korean Youth Vow to Carry Forward Revolutionary Cause of Juche
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting of young vanguard at the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday to vow to carry forward the revolutionary cause of Juche under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, delegates to the events for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the youth league, youth and students.
					
					 Loyal members of the relay group of young vanguard of Pyongyang City entered the meeting place.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, made a report to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il that the relay group which started on the top of Mt. Paektu on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the youth league arrived at the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					
					 All the participants made a bow to the portraits of the smiling great leaders.
					
					 A poem dedicated to the great leaders, the founder and builder of the youth league, was recited on the occasion.
					
					 A resolution on carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un was read out by Jon Yong Nam.
					
					 All the participants resolutely vowed to dynamically fight for the final victory of the revolution under the red flag of the Workers' Party of Korea, rallied close around Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK's Access to H-bomb Supported by Congolese Youth Body
articles.content:
DPRK's Access to H-bomb Supported by Congolese Youth Body
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK had access to H-bomb of justice, standing against the U.S. seeking to occupy it with huge nuclear weapons. It is a legitimate self-defensive right of a sovereign state and a just measure nobody is allowed to slander.
					 The Socialist Youth Organization of Congo said this in a statement on January 11.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The H-bomb test conducted by the DPRK by its own wisdom, technology and efforts fully confirmed that technical specifications of the newly developed trial H-bomb were correct, and scientifically proved the power of the smaller H-bomb.
					
					 We warmly hail the DPRK's H-bomb test as a measure to firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the vital right of the nation from the ever-escalating nuclear threat and blackmail by the hostile forces and creditably guarantee peace in the Korean Peninsula and regional security.

articles.title: DPRK's H-bomb Test Supported by British, Czech Newspapers
articles.content:
DPRK's H-bomb Test Supported by British, Czech Newspapers
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The British and Czech newspapers carried special write-ups, congratulating the DPRK on its successful H-bomb test.
					 The New Worker, the organ of the New Communist Party of Britain, on January 8 carried an article illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test is a measure to firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the right of the nation to live from daily-increasing nuclear threat and blackmail by the U.S.-led hostile forces and reliably ensure peace in the Korean Peninsula and the regional security.
					
					 The U.S. should halt all hostile policies including military exercises against the DPRK without any precondition.
					
					 This is the only way for ensuring peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the region.
					
					 Proscejobska Pravda, newspaper of the Czech Republic, on January 10 said in an article:
					
					 The editorial board of Proscejobska Pravda highly appreciates the technical development of the DPRK which successfully conducted the H-bomb test.
					
					 There is no news more pleasant than that there are in the world the strong people not yielding to invaders.
					
					 We support the DPRK's access to H-bomb and hope that it would bolster deterrent.

articles.title: DPRK's H-bomb Test Supported by Italian Political Party
articles.content:
DPRK's H-bomb Test Supported by Italian Political Party
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Italy issued a statement on January 7 supporting the DPRK's successful H-bomb test.
					 The statement said:
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. which has deployed a lot of nuclear bombs in different parts of the world. It is also none other than the U.S. which dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.
					
					 The DPRK conducted an H-bomb test this time.
					
					 But the DPRK has never ignited a war against other countries, unlike the U.S. provoking wars in different parts of the world.
					
					 Those countries possessed of nuclear weapons through many nuclear tests are talking about sanctions on the DPRK.
					
					 Such facts prove that the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons for self-defence, not yielding to imperialism, is a just action for defending the sovereignty of the country.

articles.title: DPRK's H-Bomb Test Supported by Newspaper of DR Congo
articles.content:
DPRK's H-Bomb Test Supported by Newspaper of DR Congo
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- L'Avenir, the newspaper of DR Congo, on Jan. 11 carried a commentary titled "How is peace defended" under the headline "DPRK's successful first H-bomb test".
					 The commentary said that the DPRK's H-bomb test stunned the world, adding:
					
					 The DPRK has chosen the way of having access to the nuclear deterrent against the U.S. attempt for nuclear attack.
					
					 Convinced that the sovereignty of the country, dignity of the nation and global peace and stability can be defended only by arms under the present situation in which the imperialists' high-handedness and invasion are rampant, the DPRK has strengthened the military capability in every way with the original Songun politics.
					
					 The peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula are directly linked to global ones.
					
					 The showdown between the DPRK which regards the sovereignty dearer than life and the U.S. which seeks to dominate the DPRK and the world will lead to a thermonuclear war.
					
					 But now that the DPRK proudly joined the advanced nuclear weapons states by having access to H-bomb, the U.S. dares not ignite a war in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The strong nuclear deterrent of the DPRK to cope with the U.S. reckless nuclear hysteria serves as the most powerful treasured sword for defending peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Political Party of Tajikistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Political Party of Tajikistan
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan released a statement on Jan. 11 supporting Marshal Kim Jong Un's New Year Address.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan extends full support to Marshal Kim Jong Un's New Year Address and demands the U.S. stop pursuing its hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for conclusion of a peace treaty with it.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people will achieve new successes in building a thriving socialist nation this year, too, under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Russian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Russian Organization
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK released a statement on Jan. 4 supporting Marshal Kim Jong Un's New Year Address.
					 The statement said Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address clarified tasks and ways for successfully advancing the Korean revolution onto a new high stage.
					
					 We are convinced that the proposal for national reunification set forth by him in his New Year Address would make positive contribution to achieving Korea's reunification.
					
					 We support the aspiration of the Korean people to peacefully reunify the country.
					
					 We also fully support constructive measures of the leadership and government of the Russian Federation to strengthen the political, economic and humanitarian relations with the DPRK.
					
					 We will as ever make all efforts to strengthen the traditional relations of friendship between the peoples of Russia and the DPRK.

articles.title: Swiss Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Men of Mt. Paektu Formed
articles.content:
Swiss Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Men of Mt. Paektu Formed
Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- A Swiss preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Men of Mt. Paektu was formed in Basel on January 10. 
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 A statement was adopted at the inaugural ceremony. 
					
					 The statement said Juche 106 (2017) is the significant year marking 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il and the 5th anniversary of Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of the top posts of the party and the state. 
					
					 It is the steadfast will of friends of Korea, followers of the Juche idea and other progressives in the world to highly praise the undying exploits of the great men of Mt. Paektu who brought freedom and happiness to the Korean people and built and developed Korean-style socialism, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 A meeting for preparing the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Men of Mt. Paektu held in Pyongyang in October, Juche 104 (2015) called for forming preparatory committees for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star in regions and countries in 2017 and for holding an international meeting on Mt. Paektu in 2017 in praise of the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea decided to form the Swiss preparatory committee to hold the meeting with splendor. 
					
					 The preparatory committee will widely introduce the undying feats of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un among the Swiss people and fully support the just struggle of the Korean people for national reunification.
